column4: how can I uninstall a piece of hardware and then reinstall it? (it's not working right)
what do you mean it is not working right?
the only way to uninstall hardware and reinstall it is to take it out and put it back in :P ... what you are thinking of is reloading the driver
right, that IS what I mean... ;). Where do I do that at?
first off you need to know the name of the driver/module, then look at modprobe (man modprobe)
where do I find the name of the driver? It's for my sound card...
I don't really know ... depends on the sound card
look in the hardware manager thingy ...
would it be what is listed in the device manager
should be (I haven't looked at it much)
would it be easier through the command line?
doubt it
what sound card and how is it misbehaiving
it's an audigy 2
maybe the driver is not completely stable, although the same card misbehaives under windows too
it was working fine. Suddenly it no longer works on my login, but works just fine for other 2 logins...
seems like a setting was changed
it would, but I can't for the life of me figure out what... I have the volume control (has the muted icon) and when I click on it I get: No volume control GStreamer plugins and/or devices found.
double click on that thing (volume control) and select the proper device
I think you selected another output device
how would another device be selected? It's possible my daughter did it by accident, but I have no idea how....
somewhere in system there should be sound or something of the sort
